edu.umw.cpsc.collegediversity
Class Sim

java.lang.Object
  sim.engine.SimState
      edu.umw.cpsc.collegediversity.Sim
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class Sim
extends sim.engine.SimState
implements sim.engine.Steppable

A simulation of evolving racial diversity on a college campus. Notes on Scheduling:

  • The time for this simulation is in years. An integer value of time represents August 1st (beginning of school year). For example, if the current time step is 0.5, that represents Feb 1st, 2014.)
  • The FreshmanFactory runs once every August 1st, instantiating new Student objects to represent that year's crop of freshmen.
  • Students are scheduled to run on the first of every month. (They're scheduled by the FreshmanFactory to run the first Sept., and then each month they schedule themselves again for following month; see Student.step(sim.engine.SimState) for details.)
  • The StatsPrinter object will run every April 30th, which is after Students' last activity of the year but before they promote themselves (and/or dropout or graduate) on May 1st.
  • This object itself will run once per year, on June 1st, promoting all students who haven't dropped out, and assigning them to next year's dorms.

See Also:

          How much does GPA matter when forming connections? This is a multiplicative factor; values less than 1 progressively decrease the significance of GPA in perceived similarity, and values greater than 1 increase it.

HOUSING_BY_RACE

public static boolean HOUSING_BY_RACE
Should the simulation take race into consideration when assigning freshman dorm rooms?

PROB_DUAL_MINORITY

public static final double PROB_DUAL_MINORITY
If HOUSING_BY_RACE is true, the probability that a minority student will be assigned a minority roommate. (Strictly speaking this isn't quite true, since if minority student A passes this dice roll, and is assigned minority student B as a roommate, then student B is already allocated a roommate (student A) and therefore won't face this dice roll.)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OUTPUT_DIRECTORY

public static final java.lang.String OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
The name of the output directory into which statistical files will be written.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GLOBAL_WEIGHT_RACE

public static final double GLOBAL_WEIGHT_RACE
How much does race matter when forming connections? This is a multiplicative factor; values less than 1 progressively decrease the significance of race in perceived similarity, and values greater than 1 increase it. "Global" means it applies uniformly to all students.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GLOBAL_WEIGHT_GPA

public static final double GLOBAL_WEIGHT_GPA
How much does GPA matter when forming connections? This is a multiplicative factor; values less than 1 progressively decrease the significance of GPA in perceived similarity, and values greater than 1 increase it. "Global" means it applies uniformly to all students.

instance

Singleton pattern.

addStudents

public void addStudents(sim.util.Bag newStudents)
Add the newly-instantiated students (perhaps new freshmen) to the simulation.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Run this simulation "headless"; i.e., without a GUI.
Command-line arguments:
  1. housingByRace -- either the word true or false, depending on whether the simulation should take race into consideration when assigning freshman dorm rooms.

start

public void start()
Begin the simulation, including everything necessary on the schedule. See Sim class comments for scheduling particulars.

Overrides:
start in class sim.engine.SimState

step

public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
Perform year-end maintenance on the simulation. This will occur every June 1st. In particular:
  • Assign all upperclassmen to dorms.
  • Increment the academic year.

Specified by:
step in interface sim.engine.Steppable

getYear

public int getYear()
Get the year in which the simulation's current academic year started. For instance, if the current time step is 2.5, that means it's currently Feb. 1st, 2016, and this method would return 2015.

getRandomStudent

public Student getRandomStudent()
Return a uniformly chosen random student from the entire student body.
